name: Observation/Result
description: The OBX segment is used to transmit a single observation or observation fragment.

fields.name: Set ID - OBX
fields.description: Sequence number for OBX segments within a message.

fields.name: Value Type
fields.description: The data type of the observation value (NM=Numeric, ST=String, CE=Coded Element, etc.).

fields.name: Observation Identifier
fields.description: Unique identifier for the observation (e.g., LOINC code).

fields.name: Observation Sub-ID
fields.description: Used to distinguish between multiple OBX segments with the same observation identifier.

fields.name: Observation Value
fields.description: The value of the observation. Data type is determined by OBX.2.

fields.name: Units
fields.description: Units of measure for the observation value.

fields.name: References Range
fields.description: Normal range for a numeric observation.

fields.name: Abnormal Flags
fields.description: Flags indicating whether the result is abnormal (H=High, L=Low, A=Abnormal, etc.).

fields.name: Nature of Abnormal Test
fields.description: Nature of the abnormal test (A=Age-specific, S=Sex-specific, etc.).

fields.name: Observation Result Status
fields.description: Status of the observation result (F=Final, P=Preliminary, C=Correction, etc.).

fields.name: Effective Date of Reference Range
fields.description: Date the reference range was last changed.

fields.name: Producer's ID
fields.description: Unique identifier of the producer (lab, instrument, etc.).

fields.name: Responsible Observer
fields.description: Identity of the person responsible for the observation.

fields.name: Observation Method
fields.description: Method used to produce the observation.

fields.name: Equipment Instance Identifier
fields.description: Identifier for the equipment that produced the observation.
